message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: 
import org.apache.axiom.attachments.Attachments;
import org.apache.axiom.om.OMElement;
import org.apache.axiom.om.impl.builder.StAXOMBuilder;
import org.apache.axiom.soap.SOAPBody;
import org.apache.axiom.soap.SOAPEnvelope;
import org.apache.axiom.soap.impl.builder.StAXSOAPModelBuilder;

import javax.xml.stream.XMLInputFactory;
import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamReader;
import java.io.InputStream;

public void parseSOAPResponse(InputStream inputStream) {
    try {
        XMLInputFactory xif = XMLInputFactory.newInstance();
        XMLStreamReader xmlReader = xif.createXMLStreamReader(inputStream);
        StAXSOAPModelBuilder builder = new StAXSOAPModelBuilder(xmlReader);
        SOAPEnvelope envelope = builder.getSOAPEnvelope();
        SOAPBody body = envelope.getBody();
        OMElement firstElement = body.getFirstElement();
        // Now you can handle the SOAP Body
    } catch (Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Apache Axiom library provides a StAXSOAPModelBuilder class that can be used to parse a SOAP response. This class takes an XMLStreamReader as an argument, which can be created from an InputStream using the XMLInputFactory. The SOAPEnvelope and SOAPBody can then be retrieved from the StAXSOAPModelBuilder. The first element of the SOAPBody can be retrieved using the getFirstElement() method. This element can then be used to handle the SOAP response.
